intro: Galium cyllenium, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium cyllenium is often found in temperate regions and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to pollinators.
